Photo by Unsplash

This Week in Genesis (#33), a Pretty new theme from Lindsey Riel, the UK Genesis podcast is back, plus, making it easier to be a guest editor on GenesisWP.guide.

It’s all looking so beautiful.

Themes

Great new theme from Lindsey Riel over at Pretty Darn Cute, called Pretty (and it certainly is). PS Nice vid.

New #genesiswp #WordPress theme for the #girlboss ?? pic.twitter.com/1MDA6KyakJ

— Lindsey Riel (@lindseyriel) January 11, 2016

Brian Gardner is playing with some new ideas.

Trying to step outside the box here. Thoughts? https://t.co/o0fotcAd7H #genesiswp

— Brian Gardner (@bgardner) January 11, 2016

Another tease of the Sunshine theme from the folks over at Simple Pro Themes.

Store layout of Sunshine Pro Genesis theme. In a week at https://t.co/IfdWQqCxW4 #genesiswp #woocommerce pic.twitter.com/z0Y2RacgiU

— Simple Pro Themes (@SimpleProThemes) January 11, 2016

Upload a "different mobile logo" right from customizer in Sunshine Pro #genesiswp theme – Jan 2016 pic.twitter.com/j9QOse1fec

— Simple Pro Themes (@SimpleProThemes) January 13, 2016

And one I missed last week, the release of Shop Pro by Chinmoy Paul.

Shop Pro – Online store theme on Genesis Framework is officially released now. https://t.co/bQKc6Seeo4

— Genesis Developer (@genesisdevelopr) January 6, 2016

Showcase

Two great new sites (as always) from Bill Erickson, pinchofyum.com

We just launched the new @pinchofyum design. Check it out! https://t.co/3EONYVVzdM pic.twitter.com/4cIJlsqig2

— Bill Erickson (@BillErickson) January 14, 2016

…and blog.dupontregistry.com

Also launched today: Autofluence by @duPontREGISTRY https://t.co/wAB52wyUDV pic.twitter.com/xqgxQ1RwF3

— Bill Erickson (@BillErickson) January 14, 2016

Jessica Barnard with a nice customisation of the Blogger Pro theme from Pretty Darn Cute for barbraveling.com

Just completed a fun customization of the Modern Blogger Pro theme by @lindseyriel for @barbraveling. 🙂 https://t.co/jMpSVvVfvN #genesiswp

— Jessica Barnard (@thepixelista) January 12, 2016

Thauna over at Bellano Studio with a new site for certified10.org

Just launched a new site for @TheCertified10 loved working on this site! #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/ufBnXsdSTJ

— Thauna (@BellanoStudio) January 12, 2016

Meli at Jelly Design Studio has a new site for pearlsonastring.com

Sharing a fun blog redesign that I worked on… https://t.co/dNgxVQnmcC #genesiswp #blogdesign pic.twitter.com/gc3kqcPBgz

— Meli (@blushandjelly) January 11, 2016

Podcasts!

The UK Genesis podcast is back with Dan Maby as the first guest of the year.

At 2pm (UTC), we've got @danmaby as a guest on the podcast. Get your Q's ready! https://t.co/3ccSaTylYo #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/uCfszR53Mj

— UK Genesis (@UKGenesis) January 13, 2016

…and Carrie Dils is also back doing her thing over on the OfficeHours.fm podcast with guest Topher DeRosia (aka @topher1kenobe).

Join me tomorrow at 2ET with @topher1kenobe to learn how better communication = better business. https://t.co/zcBk0Hpnrp

— Office Hours Podcast (@officehoursfm) January 13, 2016

(And if you missed last week’s episode of OfficeHours.fm – like I did, oops! – be sure to catch that as well where Carrie outlines her podcast plans for the year).

Best of the rest

Nice article from Ryan Meier on Adding Meta Boxes To Your Post Type Archive Settings In Genesis.

Adding Meta Boxes To Your Post Type Archive Settings In Genesis https://t.co/GLzERfpM5h #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/zYnmvI4ixw

— Ryan Meier (@rfmeier) January 15, 2016

Bradley Potter has a theory…

Somewhere someone is making a page builder specifically for #genesiswp. I can sense it.

— Bradley Potter (@bradleypotter) January 10, 2016

..and he’s working on a theme.

Made some subtle changes to https://t.co/9Rk5QL0kV9 – Next up, design a front page for it

— Bradley Potter (@bradleypotter) January 15, 2016

Rafal Tomal passes the torch on StudioPress designs to the very good hands of Lauren Mancke and Calvin Koepke.

I passed the torch to @laurenmancke and @cjkoepke when it comes to Copyblogger and StudioPress designs. These sites are in good hands now 🙂

— Rafal Tomal (@RafalTomal) January 11, 2016

Calvin’s working hard on his awesome looking Starter theme…

Working on Starter a bit tonight. Mobile-first, remember? Get notified when it launches — https://t.co/eOZxgAuyZR pic.twitter.com/6WWDlyhkvP

— Calvin Koepke (@cjkoepke) January 14, 2016

…and he’s doing a weekly email too.

Did you know I'm starting a weekly newsletter for entrepreneurs and web designers? You can sign up here, for free — https://t.co/LaC5yCnLnN

— Calvin Koepke (@cjkoepke) January 13, 2016

Jon Barrat over at Krolyn has been a busy bee. First, updating his ENVY themes to support the Genesis accessibility improvements…

ENVY PRO V1.2.2 released with minor changes. Remember, ENVY themes now integrate #genesiswp Accessibility. https://t.co/LgUGwMSRmi

— Jon Barratt – Krolyn (@KrolynStudios) January 8, 2016

…and, second, an update for his WP CLIPS project.

WP CLIPS V1.0.2 now released. Includes version tracking for the plugin and Precoded Clips. https://t.co/TD7mnMjPJG pic.twitter.com/zJKBFbLrXI

— Jon Barratt – Krolyn (@KrolynStudios) January 8, 2016

Beta list!

I was pretty blown away that 25+ of you signed up to the GenesisWP.guide ‘beta’ email list (to be notified about / help test new features) last week. You are all extremely awesome.

…& if you signed up & didn't get an email yet, don't worry, will be emailing everyone just as soon as there's something cool to look at 🙂

— GenesisWPguide (@GenesisWPguide) January 14, 2016

If you’re reading this and you want to join them, check out the signup page, and don’t worry you haven’t missed anything yet.

(I’ve been closing a couple of projects that were taking up way too much of my time but I should have some time to start playing with this next week).

As soon as I have something to look at, everyone on the email list will be the first to know I promise (OK, I might give Calvin a sneak look first but right after that 😉 )

Guest editors!

Want to guest edit This Week in Genesis? https://t.co/lCyrSWad11 pic.twitter.com/ZiAMhokCOf

— GenesisWPguide (@GenesisWPguide) January 15, 2016

I’m delighted to say that, after Tara’s stellar debut, last year, they’ll be a whole lot more guest editors of This Week in Genesis this year as part of my mission to get more voices from the community on GenesisWP.guide.

If you’d like to join them, and find out more, go fill out this form!

And finally…

Huge congrats to the Genesis community’s Jesse Petersen who hit his fundraising target for raising legal funds to move the adoption process for baby Parker forwards.

Jesse is an awesome guy and I just wanted to say best of luck to him and his family for hopefully a smooth process from here.

Parker is so happy! #AdoptParker #SurpriseAdoption pic.twitter.com/VIrhNELK0p

— Jesse Ⓦ Petersen (@jpetersen) January 12, 2016

#AdoptParker is mission accomplished for Phase 1: Court case! Thank you all for loving us and this little boy. pic.twitter.com/P3MI0Pkaci

— Jesse Ⓦ Petersen (@jpetersen) January 12, 2016

Oh and his donation website? Running on Genesis of course 😉

I can't get over how fast https://t.co/cT4LNmkFP6 is. @digitalocean 1GB, @ServerPilot, #genesiswp, @GiveWP, & @letsencrypt. PHP7 FTW.

— Jesse Ⓦ Petersen (@jpetersen) January 10, 2016

That’s all for this week.

Next week’s edition will be edited by the awesome Dhishna Chandnani.

Until then, have a great weekend!

PS As much as I try to cover everything awesome in Genesis every week I sometimes miss something cool (the solution for that is hopefully coming in the ‘beta’ project). In the meantime, if you think I missed something good, please add it in the comments below!
